ygData.messageBody:
Ok, I agree with you.. but what you are asking for is a programming miracle.
Unfortunately it's incredibly hard (possibly impossible ?) to be able to
program a game to distinguish between the two circumstances. So Verant
chose to allow them to pass through walls and avoid having exploitable
situations. Realistically they had to chose one way or the other, and I
can't say I disagree with their choice.


Tandayen, Dark Elf Wizard

>From: "Wizard LABBS" <wizard-labbs@...>

>You are right. I don't believe that you should be able to nuke thing that
>are in a building if you are not in the building yourself or nuke things
>outside a building if you are in it. What I am saying is that monsters
>should not beable to walk through walls to get at you or to get away. I
>think that they should have the same limitations as us. If we get them in
>stuck (say two big rocks) between objects and can take them on one at a
time
>then that is using our heads. I don't think that the NPC should be able to
>pass through them just because they CAN.
